Package br.com.concepting.framework.util

Class PropertyUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • br.com.concepting.framework.util.PropertyUtil
  • public class PropertyUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    Class responsible to manipulate properties of classes and methods.
    Since:
    1.0.0

      • compareTo

        public static int compareTo​(java.lang.Object object1,
                            java.lang.Object object2)
        Compares two objects.
        Parameters:
        object1 - Object 1.
        object2 - Object 2.
        Returns:
        1 - Indicates that the numeric value 1 is greater than numeric value 2. value 2. 0 - Indicates that the numeric value 1 is equal to the numeric value 2. value 2. -1 - Indicates that the numeric value 1 is less than numeric value 2.

      • parse

        public static <O> O parse​(java.lang.Class<O> clazz,
                          java.lang.String value,
                          java.lang.String pattern,
                          boolean useAdditionalParsing,
                          int precision,
                          java.util.Locale language)
                   throws java.text.ParseException,
                          java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException
        Parses a content.
        Type Parameters:
        O - Class that defines the content.
        Parameters:
        clazz - Class that defines the content.
        value - String that contains the content.
        pattern - String that contains the parsing pattern.
        useAdditionalParsing - Indicates if it must be used as an additional pattern for parsing.
        precision - Numeric value that defines the precision.
        language - Instance that defines the
        Returns:
        Returns the parsed content.
        Throws:
        java.text.ParseException - Occurs when was not possible to execute the operation.
        java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException - Occurs when was not possible to execute the operation.

      • fillPropertiesInString

        public static <O> java.lang.String fillPropertiesInString​(O instance,
                                                          java.lang.String value)
        Replaces the instance properties in a string. The string should be declared like the following: 
        #{<property-name>.<child-property-name>} E.g.: #{loginSession.user.name}
        Type Parameters:
        O - Class that defines the instance.
        Parameters:
        instance - Instance that will be used.
        value - String before the processing.
        Returns:
        String after the processing.

      • fillPropertiesInString

        public static <O> java.lang.String fillPropertiesInString​(O instance,
                                                          java.lang.String value,
                                                          boolean replaceNotFoundMatches,
                                                          java.util.Locale language)
        Replaces the instance properties in a string. The string should be declared like the following: 
        #{<property-name>.<child-property-name>} E.g.: #{loginSession.user.name}
        Type Parameters:
        O - Class that defines the instance.
        Parameters:
        instance - Instance that will be used.
        value - String before the processing.
        replaceNotFoundMatches - Indicates if the properties that were not found should be replaced with blank.
        language - Instance that contains the language that will be used.
        Returns:
        String after the processing.

      • fillPropertiesInString

        public static <O> java.lang.String fillPropertiesInString​(O instance,
                                                          java.lang.String value,
                                                          boolean replaceNotFoundMatches,
                                                          boolean escapeCrlf,
                                                          java.util.Locale language)
        Replaces the instance properties in a string. The string should be declared like the following: 
        #{<property-name>.<child-property-name>} E.g.: #{loginSession.user.name}
        Type Parameters:
        O - Class that defines the instance.
        Parameters:
        instance - Instance that will be used.
        value - String before the processing.
        replaceNotFoundMatches - Indicates if the properties that were not found should be replaced with blank.
        escapeCrlf - Indicates if it should escape CRLF in the replacements.
        language - Instance that contains the language that will be used.
        Returns:
        String after the processing.
